com.novartis.opensource.yada.test

Class ServiceTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.novartis.opensource.yada.test.ServiceTest

  • public class ServiceTest
extends Object
    Tests all manner of queries via API and HTTP. Uses query parameter strings and json strings stored in resources as test cases
    Author:
    David Varon

      void testHarmonizer(String query)
      Tests many aspects of harmonyMap or h YADA parameter results including for CSV: column counts, header values, row counts, row/column content; and for JSON: singular result set, correct mapped/unmapped keys and values, record count.

      Tests harmonyMap specs on REST queries using literal results for validation

      boolean validateDate(String result)
      As the name suggests, confirms that the value of result is a parsable date, or throws an exception.
      boolean validateDelimitedData(String result, String delimiter)
      Evaluates the query result content to ensure data values are consistent with expected type and for date and time, with value.

      Validation method for HTML response.

      Calls validateInteger(String, boolean) with log=false

      As the name suggests, confirms that the value of result is an integer, or throws an exception.

      • l

        private static org.apache.log4j.Logger l
        Local logger handle

      • LOG_STDOUT

        protected static final String LOG_STDOUT
        Constant ref to log.stdout system property. When present or true, prints qname and result to console during testing. This is useful for troubleshooting but otherwise a pain.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • host

        protected String host
        The yada server used for http and soap tests. Defaults to: localhost:8080

      • uri

        protected String uri
        The yada resource for brokering the request. All requests are ultimately forwarded to yada.jsp, but the framework can support access to the jsp without the extension (yada?param=val), and also path-style parameters with and without the 'yada' path element, e.g., /yada/param/value or simply /param/value

      • proxy

        protected String proxy
        The proxy server to use in for external REST queries

      • auth

        protected String auth
        The flag to use authentication

      • loadResource

        public String[] loadResource(String path)
                      throws URISyntaxException,
                             IOException
        Loads the resource at path containing query parameter or json strings
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the test script
        Returns:
        an array of query or json strings
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException - when a handle can't be attached to the test file path
        IOException - if the InputStream used for reading test files can't be closed

      • mergeArrays

                     throws URISyntaxException,
                            IOException

        Returns:
        an array of query or JSON strings
        Throws:

        IOException - if the InputStream used for reading test files can't be closed

      • isComment

        public boolean isComment(String query)
        Evaluates text line in resource, returning true if line starts with a hashmark: #
        Parameters:
        query - the line from the test script to test
        Returns:
        true if line starts with #

      • isNotWindows

        public boolean isNotWindows()
        Tests if the current execution environment is a variant of Windows, which will cause some tests to fail.
        Returns:
        true if the os.name property does not contain the string win, otherwise false

        public void dbPrep()

                   YADAQueryConfigurationException,

        URISyntaxException - when a handle can't be attached to the test file path

            throws URISyntaxException,
                   YADAQueryConfigurationException,
                   IOException
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException - if the test files content can't be loaded
        YADAQueryConfigurationException - if the queries in the test are malformed
        IOException - if the InputStream used for reading test files can't be closed

        public void prepOrClean(String[] paths)
                 throws URISyntaxException,
                        IOException,
                        YADAQueryConfigurationException
        Utility method to prep or clean the db before or after each test execution by executing the queries in paths
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        YADAQueryConfigurationException - when request creation fails

                           YADAResponseException

      • validate

        public boolean validate(YADARequest req,
               String result)
                 throws YADAResponseException
        Parameters:
        req - the YADARequest containing the test query
        result - the String returned by Service.execute()
        Returns:
        true if result conforms to the regular expression pattern corresponding to the value of YADARequest.getFormat()
        Throws:
        YADAResponseException - when the test result is invalid

      • validateInteger

        public boolean validateInteger(String result,
                      boolean log)
                        throws NumberFormatException
        As the name suggests, confirms that the value of result is an integer, or throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        result - the String returned by Service.execute()
        log - true to print the value of the integer, false to suppress
        Returns:
        true when the value of result can be converted to an Integer
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - when the value of result cannot be converted to an Integer

      • validateInteger

        public boolean validateInteger(String result)
                        throws NumberFormatException
        Calls validateInteger(String, boolean) with log=false
        Parameters:
        result - the String returned by Service.execute()
        Returns:
        true when the value of result can be converted to an Integer
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - when the value of result cannot be converted to an Integer

      • validateNumber

        public boolean validateNumber(String result)
                       throws NumberFormatException
        As the name suggests, confirms that the value of result is a float, or throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        result - the String returned by Service.execute()
        Returns:
        true when the value of result can be converted to a Float
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - when the value of result cannot be converted to a Float

      • validateDate

        public boolean validateDate(String result)
                     throws ParseException
        As the name suggests, confirms that the value of result is a parsable date, or throws an exception. The method uses DateFormat with the default leniency (true)

        Valid values for date fields are 2015-03-04 00:00:00 (1362373200000L) and 2015-04-14 00:00:00 (1365912000000L)

        Parameters:
        result - the String returned by Service.execute()
        Returns:
        true when the value of result can be converted to a Date
        Throws:
        ParseException - when the value of result cannot be converted to a Date

      • validateTime

        public boolean validateTime(String result)
                     throws ParseException
        As the name suggests, confirms that the value of result is a parsable time, or throws an exception. The method uses DateFormat with the default leniency (true)

        Valid values for time fields are 2015-09-05 20:44:33 (1441500273000L) and 2015-09-05 20:44:46 (1441500286000L)

        Parameters:
        result - the String returned by Service.execute()
        Returns:
        true when the value of result can be converted to a Date
        Throws:
        ParseException - when the value of result cannot be converted to a Date

      • validateJSONData

        public boolean validateJSONData(org.json.JSONObject j)
                         throws YADAResponseException
        Evaluates the query result content to ensure data values are consistent with expected type and for date and time, with value.
        Parameters:
        j - the JSONObject to evaluate
        Returns:
        true if each column's data type is preserved and values are parsable
        Throws:
        YADAResponseException - when j is malformed or contains invalid data

      • validateDelimitedData

        public boolean validateDelimitedData(String result,
                            String delimiter)
                              throws YADAResponseException
        Evaluates the query result content to ensure data values are consistent with expected type and for date and time, with value.
        Parameters:
        result - the subset of data (usu. one line) returned by the query
        delimiter - the character separating columns, i.e., tab, pipe, comma, etc.
        Returns:
        true if each column's data type is preserved and values are parsable
        Throws:
        YADAResponseException - when result is malformed or contains invalid data

      • validateJSONResult

        public boolean validateJSONResult(String result)
                           throws YADAResponseException
        Validation method for JSON response. Confirms the following:
        • Result is well-formed JSON
        • Result has "RESULTSETS" key, and has "total" key with value > 0, or
        • Result has "RESULTSET" key, and has "total" key with value > 0, or
        • Result has "RESULTSET" key (but no "total" key)
        Parameters:
        result - the query result
        Returns:
        true if result complies with expected output spec
        Throws:
        YADAResponseException - when the test produces malformed results

      • validateThirdPartyJSONResult

                                     throws YADAExecutionException
        Validation method for external REST result
        Parameters:
        result - the query result
        Returns:
        true if result complies with expected output spec
        Throws:
        YADAExecutionException - when the test fails
